medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric and right upper quadrant pain with nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports that the pain started 2 days ago at 4 AM. She describes the pain as severe crampy pain in her epigastrium and right upper abdomen, radiating to the back. Symptoms have persisted, with one episode of non-bilious emesis this morning and several episodes of non-bloody diarrhea over the past 2 days. The patient denies fever and chills. Prior to the onset, she consumed corn bread and turnips.
medical_history.past_medical_history: IDDM with retinopathy and neuropathy, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, colonic adenomas, peptic ulcer disease (small amount of bleeding treated conservatively years ago), and diverticulosis.
medical_history.family_history: Patient's mother is deceased, had cerebrovascular accident (CVA) and diabetes mellitus (DM). Father died from myocardial infarction (MI). Siblings have diabetes mellitus and hypertension.
